result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erika Lee Schurtz

records.addlTxt: 11:35 am CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Erika Lee Schurtz in court. Attorney Angela Raye Olson in court for Erika Lee Schurtz. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct. Court withholds entry of judgment in favor of the 6 month diversion agreement. Court reviews conditions of agreement, approves and signs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
COMPAS Assessment. SEALED w/ access to attys. Reviewed by RMW.  gll
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson   DF:  Erika Lee Schurtz appeared. Case called at 11:33 a.m. Court notes this matter was scheduled to check on status of counsel. Atty Olson has been received. DE will be obtaining a COMPAS Assessment today. Court will schedule for a plea. If not ready to resolve on that date, file letter with the Court. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Court adjourned at 11:35 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Signed by RMW on 06/07/22.   DENIED- not indigent.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

- BOND ON FILE

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Brandon S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Intern Connor Smith and  Holly Elkin Rockow. Erika Lee Schurtz pro se. Case called at 1:44 p.m. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Does not qualify for PD services. Given PFAC. State requesting cash remain. Court enters a NG plea and preserves all pre plea rights.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
